They don't know what services exist, where to apply, what documents are needed, or how to track applications. Language barriers make it worse.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • Service Portal (multilingual) for browsing and requesting services. 
  • Service Catalog lists available programs (legal aid, ESL, job training) as requestable items. 
  • Case Management tracks each person's journey and application statuses in one place. 
  • Knowledge Management provides multilingual guides and FAQs. 
  • Virtual Agent answers questions 24/7 in multiple languages. 
  • Flow Designer automates document deadline reminders and application routing. 
  • Performance Analytics shows service demand and gaps. 
  • Integration Hub connects to partner agencies for real-time updates.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Multilingual support, Integration Hub connectors, SMS gateway, document storage, calendar integration, identity verification.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Keeping service information current, translation quality, data privacy for immigration status, getting agencies to integrate systems, building community trust, managing varying tech literacy.
